channel.title: CVE Feed for webfactory -- all
channel.description: The latest CVEs for webfactory -- all products

item.title: CVE-2023-1913|2024-08-02T06:05:26.721Z -- webfactory -- maps%20widget%20for%20google%20maps
item.description: The Maps Widget for Google Maps for WordPress is vulnerable to Stored Cross-Site Scripting via widget settings in versions up to, and including, 4.24 due to insufficient input sanitization and output escaping. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with administrator-level permissions and above, to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that will execute whenever a user accesses an injected page. This only affects multi-site installations and installations where unfiltered_html has been disabled.

item.title: CVE-2023-0832|2024-08-02T05:24:34.489Z -- webfactory -- under%20construction
item.description: The Under Construction plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Cross-Site Request Forgery in versions up to, and including, 3.96. This is due to missing or incorrect nonce validation on the install_weglot function called via the admin_action_install_weglot action. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to perform an unauthorized install of the Weglot Translate plugin via a forged request granted they can trick a site administrator into performing an action such as clicking on a link.

item.title: CVE-2023-0831|2024-08-02T05:24:34.546Z -- webfactory -- under%20construction
item.description: The Under Construction plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Cross-Site Request Forgery in versions up to, and including, 3.96. This is due to missing or incorrect nonce validation on the dismiss_notice function called via the admin_action_ucp_dismiss_notice action. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to dismiss plugin notifications via a forged request granted they can trick a site administrator into performing an action such as clicking on a link.

item.title: CVE-2023-5062|2024-08-02T07:44:53.893Z -- webfactory -- wordpress%20charts
item.description: The WordPress Charts plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Stored Cross-Site Scripting via 'wp_charts' shortcode in versions up to, and including, 0.7.0 due to insufficient input sanitization and output escaping on user supplied attributes. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers with contributor-level and above permissions to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that will execute whenever a user accesses an injected page.

item.title: CVE-2024-4661|2024-08-01T20:47:41.503Z -- webfactory -- wp%20reset%20%E2%80%93%20most%20advanced%20wordpress%20reset%20tool
item.description: The WP Reset plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to unauthorized modification of data due to a missing capability check on the save_ajax function in all versions up to, and including, 2.02. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with subscriber-level access and above, to modify the value fo the 'License Key' field for the 'Activate Pro License' setting.

item.title: CVE-2023-6799|2024-07-05T17:22:41.569Z -- webfactory -- wp%20reset%20%E2%80%93%20most%20advanced%20wordpress%20reset%20tool
item.description: The WP Reset – Most Advanced WordPress Reset Tool plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Sensitive Information Exposure in all versions up to, and including, 2.0 via the use of insufficiently random snapshot names. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to extract sensitive data including site backups by brute-forcing the snapshot filenames. Please note that the vendor does not plan to do any further hardening on this functionality.

item.title: CVE-2024-1501|2024-07-05T17:21:52.186Z -- webfactory -- database%20reset
item.description: The Database Reset plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Cross-Site Request Forgery in all versions up to, and including, 3.22. This is due to missing or incorrect nonce validation on the install_wpr() function. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to install the WP Reset Plugin via a forged request granted they can trick a site administrator into performing an action such as clicking on a link.

item.title: CVE-2024-1075|2024-07-05T17:21:34.056Z -- webfactory -- minimal%20coming%20soon%20%E2%80%93%20coming%20soon%20page
item.description: The Minimal Coming Soon – Coming Soon Page plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to maintenance mode bypass and information disclosure in all versions up to, and including, 2.37. This is due to the plugin improperly validating the request path. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to bypass maintenance mode and view pages that should be hidden.

item.title: CVE-2023-6799|2024-05-10T15:56:42.718Z -- webfactory -- wp%20reset%20%E2%80%93%20most%20advanced%20wordpress%20reset%20tool
item.description: The WP Reset – Most Advanced WordPress Reset Tool plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Sensitive Information Exposure in all versions up to, and including, 2.0 via the use of insufficiently random snapshot names. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to extract sensitive data including site backups by brute-forcing the snapshot filenames. Please note that the vendor does not plan to do any further hardening on this functionality.

item.title: CVE-2024-5087|2024-06-11T00:55:52.397Z -- webfactory -- minimal%20coming%20soon%20%E2%80%93%20coming%20soon%20page
item.description: The Minimal Coming Soon – Coming Soon Page plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to unauthorized modification of data due to a missing capability check on the validate_ajax, deactivate_ajax, and save_ajax functions in all versions up to, and including, 2.38. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with Subscriber-level access and above, to edit the license key, which could disable features of the plugin.

item.title: CVE-2024-5770|2024-06-10T18:46:40.193Z -- webfactory -- wp%20force%20ssl%20%26%20https%20ssl%20redirect
item.description: The WP Force SSL & HTTPS SSL Redirect plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to unauthorized modification of data due to a missing capability check on the 'ajax_save_setting' function in versions up to, and including, 1.66. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, subscriber-level permissions and above, to update the plugin settings.

item.title: CVE-2024-1501|2024-02-21T03:36:00.166Z -- webfactory -- database%20reset
item.description: The Database Reset plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Cross-Site Request Forgery in all versions up to, and including, 3.22. This is due to missing or incorrect nonce validation on the install_wpr() function. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to install the WP Reset Plugin via a forged request granted they can trick a site administrator into performing an action such as clicking on a link.

item.title: CVE-2024-1075|2024-02-05T21:21:50.435Z -- webfactory -- minimal%20coming%20soon%20%E2%80%93%20coming%20soon%20page
item.description: The Minimal Coming Soon – Coming Soon Page plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to maintenance mode bypass and information disclosure in all versions up to, and including, 2.37. This is due to the plugin improperly validating the request path. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to bypass maintenance mode and view pages that should be hidden.

item.title: CVE-2024-1340|2024-06-04T18:00:52.008Z -- webfactory -- login%20lockdown%20%E2%80%93%20protect%20login%20form
item.description: The Login Lockdown – Protect Login Form plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to unauthorized access of data due to a missing capability check on the generate_export_file function in all versions up to, and including, 2.08. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with subscriber access and higher, to export this plugin's settings that include whitelisted IP addresses as well as a global unlock key. With the global unlock key an attacker can add their IP address to the whitelist.

item.title: CVE-2024-4661|2024-06-08T05:44:28.733Z -- webfactory -- wp%20reset%20%E2%80%93%20most%20advanced%20wordpress%20reset%20tool
item.description: The WP Reset plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to unauthorized modification of data due to a missing capability check on the save_ajax function in all versions up to, and including, 2.02. This is due to the plugin improperly validating the request path. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to bypass maintenance mode and view pages that should be hidden.

item.title: CVE-2024-1340|2024-08-01T18:33:25.429Z -- webfactory -- login%20lockdown%20%E2%80%93%20protect%20login%20form
item.description: The Login Lockdown – Protect Login Form plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to unauthorized access of data due to a missing capability check on the generate_export_file function in all versions up to, and including, 2.08. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with subscriber access and higher, to export this plugin's settings that include whitelisted IP addresses as well as a global unlock key. With the global unlock key an attacker can add their IP address to the whitelist.

This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, subscriber-level permissions and above, to update the plugin settings.
